episode_summary: This Christmas special episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' features festive facts about the unfunny jokes selected for Christmas crackers, a priest issuing knuckle dusters to protect nativity scenes, public sentiment towards carol singers, and the extreme makeup process Jim Carrey endured for 'The Grinch'.

facts.fact: Every year in the UK, a joke committee gets together to whittle down a short list of jokes that they think are unfunny enough to put in Christmas crackers.
In the 1880s, to defend against attacks on nativity scenes, one priest issued knuckle dusters to his congregation.

When asked this year, 21% of people said they didn't want Christmas carol singers visiting their home because of coronavirus, and another 55% said they didn't want carol singers regardless of coronavirus.
Jim Carrey's makeup for the Grinch was so onerous to apply, the studio brought in one of the CIA's experts at enduring torture to help him get through it.
